text: Zuhur Dixon (born 1933) is an Iraqi poet. She was born in Abu Al-Khaseeb. Dixon later moved to Baghdad with her husband. Her writing deals with the role of women in a very traditional society. Her work was included in the anthologies Modern Arabic Poetry: An Anthology and This Same Sky: A Collection of Poems from Around the World. == Selected works == * Cities have another awakening, poetry (1976) * A Homeland for Everything, poetry (1979) == References == Category:1933 births Category:Living people Category:Iraqi women writers Category:Women poets Category:20th-century Iraqi poets Category:20th- century Iraqi women writers Category:21st-century Iraqi poets Category:21st- century Iraqi women writers Category:People from Basra Province Category:Writers from Baghdad
